title: Inherited mutation leads to overproduction of erythropoietin in blood

title_detail.value: Inherited mutation leads to overproduction of erythropoietin in blood

summary: A newly-discovered hereditary mutation is responsible for an increased production of erythropoietin (EPO) in the blood. This mutation causes a messenger RNA (mRNA) that is not normally involved in the formation of proteins to be reprogrammed so that it produces EPO, thus abnormally increasing the number of red blood cells.
